com.tokelon.toktales.core.game.state

Interface IGameState

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IConsoleGamestate, IEngineGamestate, ILocalMapGamestate, ISubEngineGamestate, ITaleGamestate, ITypedGameState<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseGamestate, ConsoleGamestate, DefaultEngineGamestate, DefaultGamestate, DesktopUserGamestate, EngineGamestate, InitialGamestate, LocalMapGamestate, SubEngineGamestate, TaleGamestate, UserGamestate

    public interface IGameState

      • assignScene

        boolean assignScene(String name,
                    IGameScene scene)
        Assigns a scene to this state with the given name.

        The scene must be compatible with this state, in that it must match the type this state expects.

        Parameters:
        name -
        scene -
        Returns:
        True if the given scene was assigned successfully, false if not.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If name or scene is null.

      • assignSceneCustom

        boolean assignSceneCustom(String name,
                          IGameSceneAssignment sceneAssignment)
        Assigns a scene using a scene assignment parameter.

        Returns whether the scene was actually assigned or not.

        Parameters:
        name -
        sceneAssignment -
        Returns:
        True if the given scene was successfully assigned, false if not.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If name or sceneAssignment is null.

      • changeScene

        boolean changeScene(String name)
        Changes to active scene to the on with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        True if the scene was successfully changed, false if not.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If name is null.

      • removeScene

        boolean removeScene(String name)
        Removes the scene for the given name if it exists.

        If the scene is the currently active scene, it cannot be removed.

        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        True if the scene was successfully removed, false if not.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If name is null.

      • getActiveScene

        IGameScene getActiveScene()
        You can override this method to return a custom scene type.
        Returns:
        The currently active scene.

      • getSceneControl

        IGameSceneControl<? extends IGameScene> getSceneControl()

      • getStateRenderer

        IGameStateRenderer getStateRenderer()
        Returns the state renderer for this state.
        Returns:
        A state render.

      • getStateInput

        IGameStateInput getStateInput()
        The state input is a manager that collects input handlers, and notifies them when new events happen.

        The implementation is platform specific and provides extended functionality to register callbacks.

        Returns:
        The state input.

      • getStateInputHandler

        IGameStateInputHandler getStateInputHandler()
        The state input handler is the default way of processing state related events, and transforming them into actions on the gamestate or gamescene.

        The following details the expected workflow:
        1. A state and platform dependent input handler is implemented and set on this state.
        2. The input handler is registered at the state input.
        3. The input handler receives inputs and uses the control scheme to process them to actions.
        4. The input handler passes the actions to the control handler.


        Notes:
        1. Sometimes you will want to implement state specific input handler, control scheme and control handler. In those cases you can override these methods to return your state specific types.
        Returns:
        The state input handler.

      • getStateControlScheme

        IControlScheme getStateControlScheme()
        The control scheme provides a mapping from inputs to actions, and is used by the state input handler for this reason.

        It is state and platform dependent.
        Returns:
        The state control scheme.

      • getStateControlHandler

        IControlHandler getStateControlHandler()
        The control handler handles all actions it is given, and is normally used by the state input handler for this reason.

        Note that state handler should first call the scene handler to make scene specific handling possible.
        Returns:
        The state control handler.
